newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee closes little changed.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee closes little changed.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee moved in a tight range on Monday despite low call rates, due to a lack of commercial demand, dealers said.
The rupee closed at its opening level of 56.63 to the dollar. The rupee closed at 56.60 on Friday.
"The amount of genuine demand was negligible. Most of the activity came from banks covering positions exposed due to high call rates in November," said a Standard Chartered dealer.
In the absence of an "extra-large" import bill, the dollar-rupee exchange rate should move between 56.50-56.75 this week, he said.
Despite call rates falling, speculators were quiet since they did not expect the Central Bank to push the dollar up aggressively, dealers said.
Call rates eased to 16 percent from an opening 18 percent since a big state bank was in the market with a lending position, said an American Express Bank dealer.
